title: Why the world’s first carbon-negative fashion brand is ‘gifting’ a sheep with every purchase
text:
The word ‘sustainable’ can mean a lot of things - especially within the fashion industry, where it’s become a catch-all buzzword to describe anything from organic cotton to recycled packaging.

This ambiguity is not lost on Edzard van der Wyck, one of the original co-founders of hosiery brand Heist, who this month launched his latest venture, Sheep Inc, a knitwear company believed to be the world’s first carbon-negative fashion brand.

“This concept of what is sustainable has become so muddled,” he says. “You can sell something made out of organic cotton and suddenly you're considered sustainable. Organic cotton is better than cotton but it's still a problematic material to use in your product.”...
